page.title: 07FOOTPATHS OF ASHILL
page.content: Ashill has{eleven footpaths}or{bridle- {ways}and these provide the few places that people can walk away from the metalled roads. The footpaths have lately been a source of contention between some farmers and the people who wish to walk them. They have been largely unused for several years, but the influx of retired people, and the increase in people wishing to walk them, led to a Parish Councillor getting them all{signposted}where they leave the metalled roads, and organising walks to ensure they remain in use. The footpaths are now being used more frequently and the next plan is to put more markers across the fields so they can be more easily followed, these are needed where fields have been put together eliminating hedges and ditches the footpaths previously followed.
